alert.note: Alert for DeWitt (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 15 at 8:47AM CDT until May 16 at 11:30PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... Sandies Creek Near Westhoff affecting DeWitt County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Sandies Creek Near Westhoff. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, Major lowland flooding from the headwaters southeast of Seguin to the Guadalupe River confluence near Cuero. The flow is over one half mile wide. Livestock are cut off and potentially drowned in low areas of the flood plain. Roads and low bridges near the creek are flooded and impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM CDT Monday the stage was 23.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 AM CDT Monday was 24.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning and continue falling to 10.5 feet Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 23.6 feet on 03/15/2007. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (10 am CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Sandies Creek Westhoff 21.0 23.7 Mon 8 am CDT 21.3 17.4 14.9 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 900 PM CDT.
